TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DebuggerBrowsableAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Determines if and how a member is displayed in the debugger variable windows. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > In .NET Framework version 2.0, the DebuggerBrowsableAttribute class is not supported by Visual Basic. Using C#, you can add expansions for custom data using the <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerTypeProxyAttribute>, <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerDisplayAttribute>, and DebuggerBrowsableAttribute. Visual Basic supports the <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerDisplayAttribute> attribute but not the DebuggerBrowsableAttribute attribute.
This attribute can be applied only as a single instance to properties and fields. It cannot be applied to assemblies.
The constructor for this attribute takes one of the <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerBrowsableState> enumeration values, which specifies one of the following states:
- <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerBrowsableState> indicates that the member is not displayed in the data window. For example, using this value for the DebuggerBrowsableAttribute on a field removes the field from the hierarchy; the field is not displayed when you expand the enclosing type by clicking the plus sign (+) for the type instance.
- <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerBrowsableState> indicates that the member is displayed but not expanded by default. This is the default behavior.
- <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerBrowsableState> indicates that the member itself is not shown, but its constituent objects are displayed if it is an array or collection.
For an example of the use of this attribute and the <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerDisplayAttribute> and <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerTypeProxyAttribute> attributes, see the example provided for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerDisplayAttribute> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Diagnostics.DebuggerBrowsableState state) cil managed

Docs.param: One of the values that specifies how to display the member.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This attribute can be applied only to properties and fields.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of a <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerBrowsableAttribute> attribute to instruct the debugger to not display the root (property name) of the `Keys` property, but to display the elements of the array that `Keys` gets. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerDisplayAttribute> class.
[!code-cs[System.Diagnostics.DebuggerBrowsableAttribute#6](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/2628aa76-f91b-44ed-9585-_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[System.Diagnostics.DebuggerBrowsableAttribute#6](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/2628aa76-f91b-44ed-9585-_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Diagnostics.DebuggerBrowsableAttribute#6](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/2628aa76-f91b-44ed-9585-_1.vb)]

Docs.exception: is not one of the values.

Docs.summary: Gets the display state for the attribute.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerBrowsableAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor uses the value of the `state` parameter to set this value.
